newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel off after earnings.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel off after earnings.

text.p: Intel Corp's shares moved lower ahead of the opening of Wall Street trading on Tuesday in reaction to the chipmaker's first quarter results.

After the market's close on Monday Intel posted first quarter results of $2.20 a share, well above Wall Street's consensus estimate of $2.07 and at the high end of so-called "whisper" number estimates.
But it warned revenues for the second quarter may be flat to only slightly higher than the first quarter.
Traders said the stock traded as low as 129-7/8 before the opening, down from Monday's close at 133-3/4.
But the stock moved off its lows after a market-friendly report on retail inflation, traders said. They cited Intel trades at 131-1/4.

Traders said Avant! Corp was sharply lower at 13-1/4, down from Monday's close at 24-1/2. On Monday the Santa Clara County, Calif. district attorney's office said it filed felony charges against Avant!, its president and other senior officials for allegedly stealing Cadence Design Systems Inc technology.
The two companies make software that helps engineers design computer chips and have been bitter rivals.

In other pre-opening action, computer maker AST Research Inc traded at 5-1/4, up from its Monday close at 4-3/4, on news Samsung Electronics Co Ltd will launch a tender offer to buy the remaining stake of AST it does not already own.
Samsung will pay $5.40 a share cash, or about $170 million, for the stake, the companies said.
